PARAGRAPH.STRING: is located in the Teton Range, Grand Teton National Park, Wyoming, immediately south of Grand Teton.
is the seventh highest in the Teton Range.
is separated from Grand Teton by a col which drops sharply to the east and west. Northeast of and well below the summit, the Teepe Glacier is situated in a cirque. From Jackson Hole,
is difficult to observe except from the northeast as
is hidden from view by Disappointment Peak.

Best access to the summit is by way of Garnet Canyon to the Lower Saddle, a broad plateau which divides Grand Teton from Middle Teton. The summit is easiest to reach when approached from the west, however, true to
is a steep technical climb from every direction, involving up to 5 pitches at Class 5.4 to reach the summit.
